results.title: Rhonda’s story : spoken by Ada Peterson
results.creator_credit: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.
description_for_label: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.

results.title: Memory lingers on
results.creator_credit: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Christina Brim’s mum died recently and a lot of memories and stories have been going around in my head. Brims pays tribute to her mother, the glue that kept her ‘large mob’ together and cohesive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Christina Brim’s mum died recently and a lot of memories and stories have been going around in my head. Brims pays tribute to her mother, the glue that kept her ‘large mob’ together and cohesive.

results.title: Barkindji memories
results.creator_credit: Simone Spencer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone Spencer shares the happy memories that filled her childhood. Her large family, her close friends and her time at school all contributed to the happy person she is today. It is also why she wants to help others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simone Spencer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Ada's story
results.creator_credit: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ada Peterson’s brother received a call twelve years ago from a person they didn’t know. It was their sister, Rhonda, who was taken as a child, a member of what is now known as the stolen generation. After getting over the initial shock and apprehension, getting to know Rhonda and her story has taken Ada’s life in a different direction, bringing her closer to celebrating who she is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Ada Peterson’s brother received a call twelve years ago from a person they didn’t know. It was their sister, Rhonda, who was taken as a child, a member of what is now known as the stolen generation. After getting over the initial shock and apprehension, getting to know Rhonda and her story has taken Ada’s life in a different direction, bringing her closer to celebrating who she is.
description_for_label: Ada Peterson’s brother received a call twelve years ago from a person they didn’t know. It was their sister, Rhonda, who was taken as a child, a member of what is now known as the stolen generation. After getting over the initial shock and apprehension, getting to know Rhonda and her story has taken Ada’s life in a different direction, bringing her closer to celebrating who she is.
